info.name: GenTaR Sandbox API
info.description:
#### Description

This is a sandbox to show the main endpoints of GenTaR.

#### Usage of HTTP Verbs

The following table describes the HTTP verbs used in the application:

| HTTP verb | Usage                                                                                                                      |
|-----------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `GET`       | GET is used to retrieve information without changing the state of the system.                                              |
| `POST`     | POST is used to submit an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the system. |
| `PUT`      | PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.                           |
| `DELETE`    | DELETE deletes the specified resource.                                                                                     |

####  Privileges
The permission to see and edit information depends on the *role* of the user and the user's association with work units and consortia. 

###### Roles, work units and consortia
A user can be related to one or several work units and consortia. In each one of those associations, the user has a role: *manager* or *general*

- _manager_: A user with administrative privileges.
- _general_: A user with permission to see information and edit it (depending also on conditions like the privacy of the resource).

 
####  Users and credentials

There are some users created in the sandbox. They have different roles and belong to different work units and consortia so you can try them with different endpoints. To use them, use the email and passoword to get a token (as explained in _Authentication_ section).

These are the credentials:

| Name        | Email                 | Password    | Work Unit | Work Unit Role | Consortium | Consortium Role |
|-------------|-----------------------|-------------|-----------|----------------|------------|-----------------|
| CMG Manager | cmg-manager@ebi.ac.uk | cmg-manager |           |                | CMG        | Manager         |
| CMG         | cmg@ebi.ac.uk         | cmg         |           |                | CMG        | General         |
| BCM Manager | bcm-manager@ebi.ac.uk | bcm-manager | BCM       | Manager        |            |                 |
| BCM         | bcm@ebi.ac.uk         | bcm         | BCM       | General        |            |                 |
| TCP         | tcp@ebi.ac.uk         | tcp         | TCP       | General        |            |                 |

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Takes the user's credentials and returns a JWT that can be used in further requests. The token has a validity of 1 hour.
The credentials format is shown below:

| Field    | Description       |
|----------|-------------------|
| userName | Email of the user |
| password | Password          |

response.name: Sign In

header.value: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Authorization, Origin, Accept, Access-Control-Request-DeliveryMethodType, Access-Control-Request-Headers

item.description:
Endpoint to authenticate a user into the system and getting a jwt as result.

### Authentication

The first step to start using the GenTaR API is to get a valid token using the user credentials. The user must use the email and the password specified at registration. If the login was successful user gets a JSON Web Token (see https://jwt.io).


After that, the user has to use the access token for authentication with each request to a protected route or resource. The tokens are signed by the server so the server can validate the signature of the token to grant access to resources. The access token is a Base64 encoded String, that must be added to Authorization HTTP header like this:

```
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJjb2RlcmFkYXIiLCJleHAiOjE0ODQ1MTUzOTUsInR5cGUiOiJSRUZSRVNIIiwiaWF0IjoxNDg0NTE1NDU1LCJ1c2VySWQiOiIxIiwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJyYWRhciJ9.zfkyc5jkPiAUEt7nU25SJxKprcPiXaiq0Q6bCJ_RrQo
```

For instance, to use the endpoint to get the current user in the system wih curl, you can have a request like the following:

```
curl -X GET \
  https://www.gentar.org/production-tracker-sandbox-api/api/people/currentPerson \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9..RuVFu3BWttKFOilVnrJhrO9SgQ4mJYE5wznfmmiKPXS3B2Gx3c1zdAH3Te1uEmYdvDr_1MIHN1-tl2T7eIvmQsnaqtyr-U6V8jnDUeml_8jGCsA80B-jncbWCjBqyqzrRwWF209flqHmD0CpG9p3bTZwuF8jAbQtVdSo-Gq6BS-WizzYXyaaZepyKHsXbKRs9pTXHwqfpE7G48NiPD0EZZVOOc8f6GDYzDU-Eq9QrZTuAmIm_qWrkZhKaFWTc78xbrx41T2CFNfUVqyZ2Xhd94RM2XQk9eDym5E4XvVOFe8e75BPh0XiRwuNFLT56tzBwKLD4p-h0k2oNlvk2F9rZg' \
```

item.name: People

request.description: Get the current user information. The current user is the owner of the token being used in this request.

header.value: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Authorization, Origin, Accept, Access-Control-Request-DeliveryMethodType, Access-Control-Request-Headers

request.description: Get the people that the current user can see/manage. The list corresponds to the people that is a General member of any consortium or work unit where the current user is a manager.

response.name: Get People

header.value: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Authorization, Origin, Accept, Access-Control-Request-DeliveryMethodType, Access-Control-Request-Headers

item.name: Create a user in the system

request.description: Allows the creation of a user in the system. The role should be defined by each work unit or consortium the user is going to belong to.

item.description:
This set of endpoints allow you to query and modify information about the people in the system, given you have the privileges to do it.

### Data
This is the information about a person in the system: 

| Field    | Description       |
|----------|-------------------|
| name        | User's name.       |
| email       | User's email (Used to log into the system).  |
| password    | Password (only when creating a user).          |
| contactable | Whether or not the user can be contacted by their email. |
| rolesWorkUnits | The work units the user belongs to, as well as the role the user has in each work unit.          |
| rolesConsortia | The consortia the user belongs to, as well as the role the user has in each consortium.        |

item.name: Gene List
Get the gene list of a consortium

request.description:
The endpoint will retrieve a list of records representing each row in the previous list. It also will retrieve, for each record, a list of projects that are associated with the genes in the record (projects which intentions by gene contains exactly the same genes).

| Field    | Description                                                                      |
|----------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Id       | Id of the record                                                                 |
| Note     | Note (text)                                                                      |
| Genes    | Gene information. Can be several genes if a multigenic project is intended.      |
| Projects | Projects that are already in the system working with the gene(s) in this record. |

response.name: Get the gene list for CMG

header.value: X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Authorization, Origin, Accept, Access-Control-Request-DeliveryMethodType, Access-Control-Request-Headers

item.name: Update the gene list of a consortium

request.description: Update the content of a list in a consortium.

response.name: Update the gene list of a consortium

formdata.description: The csv file to be loaded.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to use a csv file to load genes in a gene list for a specific consortium. The file must have the following structure:

| Gene         | Note   |
|--------------|--------|
| gene1        | Note 1 |
| gene2, gene3 | Note 2 |

item.description:
#### Get the gene list for a consortium

##### Definition
A member of a consortium has access to the consortium gene list. There are separate lists for each consortium. The list can be used to record all genes of interest to the consortium, not just those entered into the production tracking system.

##### Content
The content of a list is something that resembles a spreadsheet with a list of genes with this format:

| Genes           | Note                                    |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------|
| Togaram1        | Gene in tier1                           |
| Flvcr2,Tomm40l  | Genes to be worked on the same project. |
